name: Hyper Compressed Archive
summary: Learn about .HYP files and view a list of programs that open them.
developer: Peter Sawatzki and Klaus Peter Nischke

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: German developers Peter Sawatzki and Klaus Peter Nischke created Hyper in the late 1980s. This shareware utility allows MS-DOS users to compress one or more files and store them in an archive that uses the .hyp extension.

description: An HYP file is a compressed archive created by Hyper, an archiving utility for MS-DOS. It contains one or more compressed files. HYP files are compressed using a variant of Lempel-Ziv-Welch (LZW) compression.

instructions: You can use Hyper to extract the files an HYP file contains. Because Hyper is available only for MS-DOS, you may have to run it in an MS-DOS emulator, such as DOSbox.
